lines.text: I can't exist by myself because I'm afraid of myself, because I'm the maker of my own evil.
There is nothing in common among women except menstruation.
Because you say "I" for me.
You look ugly. You've hardened. For the first time, you look vulgar to me.
There is nothing to fear except God, whatever that means to you.
For me, God is a disease.
That's why through a disease we can reach God.

[to Zimmermann, about the creature]
He's very tired. He made love to me all night.
Do you want me to break down the bloody door?
You don't have to it's open.
Love isn't something you can just switch from channel to channel.
Goodness is only some kind of reflection upon evil. That's all it is.
If you want to stay, make that call.
Don't open! Don't open! Don't open! Don't open! Please don't open! Don't open it! Don't open! Don't open it! Don't open!
You know, when I'm away from you, I think of you as a monster or a woman possessed, and then I see you again and all this disappears.
No one is good or bad, but if you want, I'm the bad one. And if I knew he existed in this world, I would have never had Bob with you!
Does our subject still wear pink socks?
Do you believe in God?
God.
It's in me.
What I miscarried there was sister Faith, and what was left is sister Chance. So I had to take care of my faith to protect it.

[to Anna]
You're my whole family.
Will you promise me something?
Yes.
Whatever it is.
I promise.
